words.definition: The use of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry.
sentences: Modern technology makes our lives easier.
Learning about new technology is exciting.
Technology changes very quickly.

words.definition: An electronic device that stores and processes data, and performs calculations.
sentences: I use my computer for homework.
My dad bought a new computer.
Computers are essential for many jobs.

words.definition: A small, portable computer that can be used on your lap.
sentences: I take my laptop to school.
She works on her laptop at the cafe.
My laptop battery lasts for hours.

words.definition: A thin, flat mobile computer with a touchscreen.
sentences: I read books on my tablet.
Kids love playing games on a tablet.
The tablet is lighter than a laptop.

words.definition: A mobile phone that also functions as a small computer.
sentences: I use my smartphone to call friends.
My smartphone has many useful apps.
He watches videos on his smartphone.

words.definition: A global computer network providing a variety of information and communication facilities.
sentences: I use the internet to find information.
The internet connects people worldwide.
Is the internet working?

words.definition: A set of related web pages served from a single web domain.
sentences: I visited a new website today.
This website has good recipes.
Create a website for your business.

words.definition: A software application for a smartphone, tablet, or computer.
sentences: I downloaded a new app for learning English.
There's an app for almost everything.
Which app do you use for maps?

words.definition: The programs and other operating information used by a computer.
sentences: This computer needs new software.
Learning to use new software can be tricky.
The software helps me edit photos.

words.definition: The physical parts of a computer or other electronic system.
sentences: The computer hardware includes the screen and keyboard.
He is good at fixing computer hardware.
Hardware and software work together.

words.definition: A set of keys for operating a computer or typewriter.
sentences: I type on the keyboard.
My keyboard has lights.
Clean your keyboard regularly.

words.definition: A small handheld device that is moved across a flat surface to control the cursor on a computer screen.
sentences: Click the mouse to open the program.
My computer mouse is wireless.
Move the mouse to control the pointer.

words.definition: The flat surface on which images or text are displayed, as on a television, computer, or phone.
sentences: The computer screen is very clear.
Don't sit too close to the screen.
My phone screen cracked when it fell.

words.definition: A machine that prints text or pictures onto paper.
sentences: I need to print this document with the printer.
Our printer is out of ink.
The printer is very fast.

words.definition: A device for taking photographs or recording videos.
sentences: I took a picture with my camera.
My phone has a good camera.
He bought a new digital camera.

words.definition: A pair of small loudspeakers worn over or in the ears.
sentences: I listen to music with my headphones.
These headphones are noise-canceling.
Don't forget your headphones for the trip.

words.definition: An electronic device that converts electrical signals into sound.
sentences: Turn up the speaker volume.
The music sounds great on these speakers.
We need a portable speaker for the party.

words.definition: A device used to put electricity into a battery.
sentences: I need my phone charger.
Did you bring your laptop charger?
The charger is not working.

words.definition: A device that produces electricity to power something.
sentences: My phone battery is low.
The car battery died.
This device runs on two AA batteries.

words.definition: A technology that allows computers and other devices to connect to the Internet wirelessly.
sentences: Is there free Wi-Fi here?
I can't connect to the Wi-Fi.
The Wi-Fi signal is strong.

words.definition: A technology that allows electronic devices to connect and exchange data wirelessly over short distances.
sentences: Connect your headphones using Bluetooth.
My car has Bluetooth for calls.
Bluetooth speakers are very convenient.

words.definition: Facts and statistics collected together for reference or analysis.
sentences: My phone ran out of data.
The company collects a lot of data.
Protect your personal data online.

words.definition: A collection of data or programs stored in a computer's memory.
sentences: Save the document as a new file.
I can't find that file on my computer.
Organize your files into folders.

words.definition: A virtual container in a computer system for organizing files.
sentences: Put all your schoolwork in one folder.
Create a new folder for your photos.
I keep important documents in a specific folder.

words.definition: To copy data from one computer system to another, typically over the Internet.
sentences: I need to download this app.
It takes a long time to download large files.
You can download music online.

words.definition: To transfer data from one computer system to another, typically to a larger computer or to the Internet.
sentences: Upload your photos to the cloud.
It takes a while to upload videos.
You can upload documents to the website.

words.definition: Messages sent from one computer to another over the Internet.
sentences: I sent an email to my teacher.
Check your email for updates.
Write a polite email.

words.definition: A secret word or phrase that must be used to gain admission to something.
sentences: Choose a strong password for your account.
I forgot my password.
Never share your password with anyone.

words.definition: A unique name that identifies a user on a computer system or website.
sentences: What's your username for this game?
Choose a username that is easy to remember.
Your username is usually your email address.

words.definition: A record of a user's activity on a computer system or website.
sentences: Create an account to use this service.
Log in to your account.
My account was hacked.

words.definition: The process of entering your username and password to access a system.
sentences: Please login to your account.
The login page is not working.
I can't complete the login process.

words.definition: The process of ending a session on a computer system or website.
sentences: Always logout when you finish using a public computer.
Click here to logout.
I forgot to logout from my social media.

words.definition: A collection of information about a user on a social media site or other online platform.
sentences: Update your profile picture.
My online profile shows my interests.
You can view other users' profiles.

words.definition: Websites and applications that enable users to create and share content or to participate in social networking.
sentences: Many people use social media every day.
Be careful what you post on social media.
Social media can connect you with old friends.

words.definition: Connected to or available through a computer network, especially the Internet.
sentences: I buy things online.
We play games online with friends.
The library has many resources available online.

words.definition: Not connected to or available through a computer network.
sentences: You can work offline on this document.
The website is currently offline for maintenance.
I prefer to read books offline.

words.definition: A program that searches for and identifies items in a database that correspond to keywords or characters specified by the user.
sentences: Google is a popular search engine.
Use a search engine to find information quickly.
I typed my question into the search engine.

words.definition: A software application for retrieving, presenting, and traversing information resources on the World Wide Web.
sentences: I use Chrome as my web browser.
Clear your browser history regularly.
Which browser do you prefer?

words.definition: A connection from one page of a website to another page or website.
sentences: Click on the link to visit the website.
She sent me a link to the article.
Broken links can be frustrating.

words.definition: To press a button on a computer mouse or other device.
sentences: Click here to continue.
He clicked the wrong button.
Just one click can open the file.

words.definition: To touch the screen of a smartphone or tablet lightly and quickly.
sentences: Tap the icon to open the app.
Tap twice to zoom in.
She tapped the screen to wake her phone.

words.definition: To move your finger across the screen of a smartphone or tablet.
sentences: Swipe left to see more photos.
Swipe up to unlock your phone.
You can swipe through different pages.

words.definition: To move text or images up, down, or across a display screen.
sentences: Scroll down to read the whole article.
Use the mouse wheel to scroll.
I scrolled through my social media feed.

words.definition: A key or combination of keys that provides a quicker way to perform a task.
sentences: Learn keyboard shortcuts to save time.
Ctrl+C is a common keyboard shortcut for copy.
Keyboard shortcuts make working faster.

words.definition: To make an exact duplicate of something, especially text or a file.
sentences: Copy and paste the text.
Make a copy of this document.
I need to copy these files to a USB drive.

words.definition: To insert copied or cut data into a document or program.
sentences: Copy the text and then paste it here.
She pasted the image into the presentation.
You can paste text without formatting.

words.definition: To remove data from one location to be pasted elsewhere.
sentences: Cut this paragraph and move it to the end.
He cut the image from the document.
Use Ctrl+X to cut text.

words.definition: To reverse the last action performed.
sentences: Click undo if you made a mistake.
I accidentally deleted it, can I undo?
The undo button is very helpful.

words.definition: To repeat an action that was previously undone.
sentences: If you undo too much, you can redo it.
The redo button brings back the last action.
She used redo to bring back the text.

words.definition: To store data in a computer's memory or on a storage device.
sentences: Don't forget to save your work.
Save the document before closing.
I saved the file to my desktop.

words.definition: To remove or erase data or files.
sentences: Delete old files to free up space.
He accidentally deleted the photo.
You can delete emails you don't need.

words.definition: To produce text or images on paper using a printer.
sentences: I need to print this report.
Can you print a copy for me?
The printer is ready to print.

words.definition: To convert a document or image into digital form using a scanner.
sentences: Scan this document and send it to me.
The scanner can scan photos.
I need to scan my passport.

words.definition: To transfer data from one computer system to another, typically to a larger computer or to the Internet.
sentences: Upload your photos to the cloud.
It takes a while to upload videos.
You can upload documents to the website.

words.definition: A method of storing digital data in multiple networked servers, rather than on a local device.
sentences: I save all my files to cloud storage.
Cloud storage allows access from anywhere.
Is your data backed up to cloud storage?

words.definition: A copy of data that can be used to restore the original if it is lost or damaged.
sentences: Always create a backup of your important files.
My computer automatically creates backups.
A regular backup prevents data loss.

words.definition: A piece of code that is capable of copying itself and typically has a detrimental effect, such as corrupting the system or destroying data.
sentences: My computer caught a virus.
Install antivirus software to protect against viruses.
A computer virus can damage your files.

words.definition: Software designed to detect, prevent, and remove malicious software, such as computer viruses.
sentences: Install antivirus software on your computer.
Antivirus programs protect your data.
Run an antivirus scan regularly.

words.definition: A network security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules.
sentences: The firewall protects my computer from threats.
A strong firewall is important for online security.
Configure your firewall settings carefully.

words.definition: A person who uses computers to gain unauthorized access to data.
sentences: A hacker tried to access my account.
Hackers can steal personal information.
Protect yourself from hackers.

words.definition: The fraudulent practice of sending emails purporting to be from reputable companies in order to induce individuals to reveal personal information.
sentences: Be aware of phishing emails.
Phishing attempts are common online.
Don't click on suspicious links to avoid phishing.

words.definition: Irrelevant or inappropriate messages sent on the Internet to a large number of recipients.
sentences: My email inbox is full of spam.
Mark unwanted emails as spam.
Spam filters help reduce junk mail.

words.definition: A new window that suddenly appears on a computer screen, typically for advertising.
sentences: Close that annoying pop-up window.
Pop-up ads can be very distracting.
Some browsers block pop-ups.

words.definition: A video camera that feeds its images in real time to a computer or computer network.
sentences: I use my webcam for video calls.
The laptop has a built-in webcam.
Ensure your webcam is clean for clear video.

words.definition: An instrument for converting sound waves into electrical energy, which may then be amplified, transmitted, or recorded.
sentences: Speak clearly into the microphone.
The microphone picked up every sound.
My headphones have a built-in microphone.

words.definition: An online seminar or presentation.
sentences: I attended a webinar on digital marketing.
Many companies host webinars for training.
Register for the upcoming webinar.

words.definition: A digital audio file made available on the Internet for downloading to a computer or mobile device.
sentences: I listen to podcasts during my commute.
This podcast tells interesting stories.
You can subscribe to your favorite podcasts.

words.definition: The process of playing sound or video directly from the Internet as it is being downloaded.
sentences: We enjoy streaming movies online.
Streaming music saves phone storage.
A fast internet connection is needed for smooth streaming.

words.definition: A device or piece of equipment designed to perform a specific task, especially a household one.
sentences: The kitchen is full of modern appliances.
My new washing machine is a smart appliance.
Energy-efficient appliances save money.

words.definition: A machine capable of carrying out a complex series of actions automatically, especially one programmable by a computer.
sentences: The factory uses robots for assembly.
Some homes have robot vacuum cleaners.
Robots are becoming more common in daily life.

words.definition: The development of computer systems able to perform tasks that normally require human intelligence.
sentences: Artificial intelligence is changing many industries.
AI can help analyze large amounts of data.
Many new apps use artificial intelligence.

words.definition: The use of computer technology to create a simulated environment that can be experienced in a seemingly physical way.
sentences: Virtual reality games are very immersive.
VR headsets are becoming more affordable.
Virtual reality can be used for training simulations.

words.definition: A technology that superimposes a computer-generated image on a user's view of the real world, thus providing a composite view.
sentences: Augmented reality apps can show virtual objects in your room.
AR is used in some mobile games.
Augmented reality combines the real and digital worlds.

words.definition: The process of writing computer programs.
sentences: Learning coding is a valuable skill.
Kids can learn coding through fun games.
Coding involves writing instructions for computers.

words.definition: A set of instructions that a computer follows to perform a task.
sentences: I wrote a simple computer program.
This program helps organize my files.
Many apps are complex computer programs.

words.definition: To provide a computer or other machine with a set of instructions.
sentences: You can program the robot to move forward.
He learned how to program in Python.
Program the device to turn off automatically.

words.definition: A set of rules or a process to be followed in problem-solving operations, especially by a computer.
sentences: Search engines use complex algorithms.
The algorithm helps sort data efficiently.
Understanding algorithms is key to computer science.

words.definition: A group of interconnected computers or other devices that can share resources and exchange data.
sentences: Our office has a secure computer network.
I can't connect to the network.
The internet is a vast global network.

words.definition: A computer or computer program that manages access to a centralized resource or service in a network.
sentences: The website is hosted on a powerful server.
The server is down, so I can't access the files.
Many online games require a stable server connection.

words.definition: A network of remote servers hosted on the Internet and used to store, manage, and process data.
sentences: Save your photos to the cloud.
Access your documents from the cloud anywhere.
The cloud offers flexible storage solutions.

words.definition: The protection of computer systems and networks from digital attacks.
sentences: Cybersecurity is very important for businesses.
Learn about cybersecurity to protect yourself online.
The company invested in strong cybersecurity measures.

words.definition: The process of converting information or data into a code, especially to prevent unauthorized access.
sentences: Your messages are protected by encryption.
Encryption keeps your online data safe.
Strong encryption is vital for secure communication.

words.definition: The process of converting encrypted data back into its original form.
sentences: The software handles the decryption automatically.
Only authorized users can perform decryption.
Decryption is the reverse of encryption.

words.definition: The combination of a username and password used to access a system or account.
sentences: Keep your login credentials private.
You need valid login credentials to enter.
Protect your login credentials from theft.

words.definition: The means by which the user and a computer system interact, in particular the use of graphical displays, menus, and other input methods.
sentences: This app has a very user-friendly interface.
A good user interface makes software easy to use.
The new design improved the user interface.

words.definition: The overall experience of a person using a product, such as a website or computer application, especially in terms of how easy or pleasing it is to use.
sentences: Good user experience is crucial for websites.
The company focuses on improving user experience.
A smooth user experience keeps customers happy.

words.definition: Information about reactions to a product, a person's performance of a task, etc., used as a basis for improvement.
sentences: Please give us feedback on the new software.
User feedback helps improve products.
We welcome all feedback from our customers.

words.definition: An error or flaw in a computer program or system.
sentences: There's a bug in the software that needs fixing.
The developers are working to fix the bug.
A software bug caused the program to crash.

words.definition: To make something more modern or current.
sentences: Update your software regularly for security.
The app needs an update.
Install the latest update for better performance.

words.definition: To put a program onto a computer or device so that it is ready to be used.
sentences: I need to install new software on my computer.
It takes a few minutes to install the update.
Did you install the game yet?

words.definition: To remove a program from a computer or device.
sentences: Uninstall old programs to free up space.
I had to uninstall the app because it was crashing.
How do I uninstall this software?

words.definition: To start a computer or device again after it has been turned off.
sentences: Try to restart your computer if it's slow.
The system requires a restart after the update.
I had to restart my phone to fix the issue.

words.definition: To restart a computer or system.
sentences: Please reboot the system.
A quick reboot often solves minor problems.
The server will reboot automatically.

words.definition: When a computer or program stops working suddenly.
sentences: My computer crashed in the middle of my work.
The app keeps crashing.
A system crash can lead to data loss.

words.definition: When a computer or program becomes unresponsive.
sentences: The screen froze and I couldn't do anything.
My computer freezes sometimes when I open too many programs.
If the app freezes, try restarting it.

words.definition: A delay between an action and its response, especially in online gaming or streaming.
sentences: The game is lagging because of my slow internet.
There's a lot of lag during video calls.
Reduce lag by closing other applications.

words.definition: The range of frequencies within a given band, used for transmitting a signal, or the capacity of a data transmission system.
sentences: We need more bandwidth for faster internet.
High bandwidth is essential for streaming 4K videos.
Limited bandwidth can cause slow downloads.

words.definition: A device that forwards data packets between computer networks.
sentences: Restart the router if your Wi-Fi isn't working.
The router provides internet access to all devices.
My new router has a strong signal.

words.definition: A device that enables a computer to transmit data over telephone or cable lines.
sentences: The modem connects to the internet service provider.
Check the lights on your modem to ensure it's working.
My modem and router are separate devices.

words.definition: A thick wire or group of wires used to carry electricity or electronic signals.
sentences: Connect the computer to the monitor with a cable.
The internet cable is plugged into the router.
Be careful not to trip over the cables.

words.definition: Using radio waves rather than wires or cables to transmit signals.
sentences: I have a wireless mouse and keyboard.
Wireless headphones are very convenient.
The printer connects wirelessly.

words.definition: A technology that allows electronic devices to connect and exchange data wirelessly over short distances.
sentences: Connect your headphones using Bluetooth.
My car has Bluetooth for calls.
Bluetooth speakers are very convenient.

words.definition: A small, portable flash memory device that plugs into a computer's USB port and is used for data storage.
sentences: Save your files to a USB drive.
I lost my USB drive with all my photos.
A USB drive is also called a flash drive.

words.definition: A high-capacity, self-contained storage device containing a read-write mechanism plus one or more platters, used to store data in computers.
sentences: My computer's hard drive is almost full.
He bought an external hard drive for extra storage.
The hard drive stores all your programs and files.

words.definition: A type of data storage device that uses integrated circuit assemblies as memory to store data persistently.
sentences: SSDs are much faster than traditional hard drives.
My new laptop has a solid-state drive.
Solid-state drives improve computer performance.

words.definition: Random-access memory; a type of computer memory that can be accessed randomly, allowing individual bytes of data to be accessed directly.
sentences: More RAM makes your computer run faster.
My computer has 16GB of RAM.
Lack of RAM can cause programs to slow down.

words.definition: The part of a computer that performs the calculations and operations.
sentences: A powerful processor is needed for gaming.
The computer has a fast Intel processor.
The processor is the 'brain' of the computer.

words.definition: The software that supports a computer's basic functions, such as scheduling tasks, executing applications, and controlling peripherals.
sentences: Windows and macOS are common operating systems.
My phone runs on the Android operating system.
An operating system manages all computer hardware and software.

words.definition: A program or piece of software designed and written to fulfill a particular purpose of the user.
sentences: This application helps me organize my photos.
Many applications are available for download.
Learning to use a new application can take time.

words.definition: A small software program that adds new features to a web browser.
sentences: I use a browser extension to block ads.
Many useful browser extensions are available.
Install a browser extension for grammar checking.

words.definition: A software component that adds a specific feature to an existing computer program.
sentences: You might need a plug-in to view this video.
The website requires a special plug-in.
Install the necessary plug-ins for full functionality.

words.definition: A network security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules.
sentences: The firewall protects my computer from threats.
A strong firewall is important for online security.
Configure your firewall settings carefully.

words.definition: Software designed to detect, prevent, and remove malicious software, such as computer viruses.
sentences: Install antivirus software on your computer.
Antivirus programs protect your data.
Run an antivirus scan regularly.

words.definition: Software that is specifically designed to disrupt, damage, or gain unauthorized access to a computer system.
sentences: Protect your computer from malware.
Malware can steal your personal information.
Antivirus software helps detect and remove malware.

words.definition: The fraudulent practice of sending emails purporting to be from reputable companies in order to induce individuals to reveal personal information.
sentences: Be aware of phishing emails.
Phishing attempts are common online.
Don't click on suspicious links to avoid phishing.

words.definition: Irrelevant or inappropriate messages sent on the Internet to a large number of recipients.
sentences: My email inbox is full of spam.
Mark unwanted emails as spam.
Spam filters help reduce junk mail.

words.definition: A small piece of data sent from a website and stored on the user's computer by the web browser while the user is browsing.
sentences: Websites use cookies to remember your preferences.
Clear your browser cookies regularly.
Some cookies are essential for website functionality.

words.definition: A collection of data duplicating original values stored elsewhere or computed earlier, for faster access.
sentences: Clear your browser cache if a website isn't loading correctly.
The computer stores frequently used data in its cache.
A large cache can speed up performance.

words.definition: A new window that suddenly appears on a computer screen, typically for advertising.
sentences: Close that annoying pop-up window.
Pop-up ads can be very distracting.
Some browsers block pop-ups.

words.definition: A message or alert that appears on a computer or mobile device to inform the user of an event or activity.
sentences: I received a notification about a new email.
Turn off notifications during meetings.
Customize your app notifications.

words.definition: The options that control how a computer program or device works.
sentences: Adjust the display settings on your monitor.
You can change the privacy settings in the app.
Go to settings to customize your phone.

words.definition: A user's chosen settings or options in a software application or system.
sentences: Save your preferences for future use.
The software remembers your preferences.
Adjust your preferences for a personalized experience.

words.definition: To make something more modern or current.
sentences: Update your software regularly for security.
The app needs an update.
Install the latest update for better performance.

words.definition: To replace something with a newer or better version.
sentences: I need to upgrade my computer's RAM.
Consider an upgrade for better performance.
The software offers a free upgrade to the premium version.

words.definition: To move to a lower level or a less powerful version.
sentences: I had to downgrade my operating system.
Sometimes a downgrade can fix compatibility issues.
They decided to downgrade their internet plan.

words.definition: To identify and fix problems in a system or piece of equipment.
sentences: I tried to troubleshoot the Wi-Fi connection.
The technician helped me troubleshoot the printer issue.
Troubleshoot the problem before calling support.

words.definition: A message displayed by a computer indicating a problem or failure.
sentences: An error message appeared on the screen.
Read the error message carefully to understand the problem.
I got an error message when trying to save.

words.definition: A change to a computer program or system that corrects a bug or glitch.
sentences: The latest update includes several bug fixes.
The developers released a bug fix for the game.
This bug fix improved performance significantly.

words.definition: A small piece of code inserted into a program to correct a defect or improve performance.
sentences: Install the security patch immediately.
The game received a new patch with bug fixes.
A software patch can resolve vulnerabilities.

words.definition: A preliminary version of a software product released for testing by a limited number of users.
sentences: I'm testing the beta version of the new app.
Beta versions often have bugs.
Join the beta program to try new features.

words.definition: The first working version of a software product, usually for internal testing.
sentences: The alpha version of the game was very basic.
Alpha versions are typically unstable.
Only a few testers had access to the alpha version.

words.definition: An early model or version of a product, built to test a concept or process.
sentences: They are developing a prototype of the new device.
The prototype showed promising results.
Engineers built a working prototype.

words.definition: The introduction of new ideas, methods, or products.
sentences: Technology drives innovation.
The company is known for its innovation in design.
Innovation is key to progress.

words.definition: A small mechanical or electronic device or tool.
sentences: He loves buying new tech gadgets.
This smart watch is a cool gadget.
Many new gadgets are released every year.

words.definition: A thing made or adapted for a particular purpose, especially a piece of mechanical or electronic equipment.
sentences: My phone is my most used device.
This new device makes cooking easier.
Connect your device to the Wi-Fi.

words.definition: Relating to or using computer technology, especially the Internet.
sentences: We live in a digital age.
She uses a digital camera.
Digital books are popular now.

words.definition: Relating to or denoting a mechanism in which data is represented by measurable quantities, such as voltage or pressure, rather than by discrete numerical values.
sentences: Old clocks are analog devices.
Analog signals can be easily affected by noise.
Some people prefer analog watches.

words.definition: Almost or nearly as described, but not completely or according to strict definition.
sentences: We had a virtual meeting online.
Virtual tours allow you to see places from home.
He created a virtual world in the game.

words.definition: The actual time during which a process or event takes place.
sentences: The app provides real-time updates.
We can see the traffic in real-time.
Real-time data is important for quick decisions.

words.definition: Allowing a two-way flow of information between a computer and a user, responding to the user's input.
sentences: The museum has interactive exhibits.
This is an interactive learning platform.
Interactive games are very engaging.

words.definition: A point where two systems, subjects, organizations, etc., meet and interact.
sentences: The new software has a simple interface.
The user interface is easy to navigate.
The interface between the human and the machine is crucial.

words.definition: Easy to use or understand.
sentences: This new app is very user-friendly.
We design products that are user-friendly.
A user-friendly website attracts more visitors.

words.definition: Without errors or defects in a computer program.
sentences: We aim to release bug-free software.
It's hard to create a completely bug-free program.
The new version is almost bug-free.

words.definition: Using the most advanced technology.
sentences: They developed a high-tech security system.
The new car has many high-tech features.
High-tech gadgets are often expensive.

words.definition: Using simple technology.
sentences: Sometimes a low-tech solution is best.
The village relies on low-tech tools.
Low-tech methods can be very effective.

words.definition: Highly advanced; innovative.
sentences: This company is known for its cutting-edge research.
They use cutting-edge technology in their products.
The new discovery is truly cutting-edge.

words.definition: No longer produced or used; out of date.
sentences: Floppy disks are now obsolete.
Many old technologies become obsolete quickly.
This software is becoming obsolete.

words.definition: No longer current or useful; old-fashioned.
sentences: My phone is a bit outdated.
Using outdated software can be risky.
The information in that book is outdated.

words.definition: Belonging to the present time; happening now.
sentences: Make sure your software is current.
What's the current version of the app?
Stay informed about current events in technology.

words.definition: Designed to remain useful or relevant in the future, even when technology changes.
sentences: Invest in future-proof technology.
This system is designed to be future-proof.
It's hard to make anything truly future-proof in tech.

words.definition: A home equipped with lighting, heating, and electronic devices that can be controlled remotely by smartphone or computer.
sentences: I want to turn my house into a smart home.
Smart home devices make life more convenient.
The smart home system controls the lights and thermostat.

words.definition: Electronic devices that can be worn on the body as accessories, embedded in clothing, or implanted in the user's body.
sentences: Smartwatches are a popular form of wearable technology.
Wearable technology tracks your fitness.
The future of wearable technology is exciting.

words.definition: A handheld electronic device for reading books or other text.
sentences: I read all my books on my e-reader.
E-readers are easy on the eyes.
My e-reader can store thousands of books.

words.definition: Global Positioning System; a satellite-based navigation system used to determine the exact location on Earth.
sentences: Use GPS to find the restaurant.
My car has a built-in GPS system.
GPS helps you navigate unfamiliar places.

words.definition: An unmanned aircraft or ship guided by remote control or onboard computers.
sentences: He flies his drone in the park.
Drones are used for aerial photography.
Delivery by drone might be common in the future.

words.definition: The process of making a three-dimensional solid object from a digital file.
sentences: 3D printing can create complex shapes.
They used 3D printing to make a prototype.
3D printing technology is advancing rapidly.

words.definition: An AI-powered software agent that can perform tasks or services for an individual.
sentences: Siri and Alexa are virtual assistants.
My virtual assistant helps me set alarms.
Virtual assistants can answer questions and play music.

words.definition: A mobile device with a touchscreen display, designed to be worn on the wrist.
sentences: My smartwatch tracks my steps.
Smartwatches can receive notifications.
He bought a new smartwatch for his birthday.

words.definition: A device or application that monitors and tracks fitness-related metrics such as distance walked, calorie consumption, and heart rate.
sentences: My fitness tracker reminds me to stand up.
Fitness trackers help you stay active.
She uses a fitness tracker to monitor her sleep.

words.definition: Commercial transactions conducted electronically on the Internet.
sentences: Online shopping is a form of e-commerce.
E-commerce has grown rapidly in recent years.
Many businesses rely on e-commerce platforms.

words.definition: A method of performing banking transactions electronically via the Internet.
sentences: I use online banking to pay my bills.
Online banking is convenient and secure.
Set up online banking for easy access to your accounts.

words.definition: A telephone call in which the participants can see each other on a screen.
sentences: We had a video call with our grandparents.
Video calls are great for staying connected.
The quality of the video call was excellent.

words.definition: An online meeting or presentation that allows participants to share information and interact.
sentences: We held a web conference with our team members.
Web conferences are common for remote work.
Join the web conference using the link provided.

words.definition: A meeting conducted online, typically with video and audio participation.
sentences: Our company holds virtual meetings every week.
Virtual meetings save time and travel costs.
Prepare for your virtual meeting by checking your camera and microphone.

words.definition: The practice of using a network of remote servers hosted on the Internet to store, manage, and process data, rather than a local server or a personal computer.
sentences: Cloud computing allows businesses to scale easily.
Many services now use cloud computing.
Cloud computing offers flexibility and cost savings.

words.definition: Extremely large data sets that may be analyzed computationally to reveal patterns, trends, and associations, especially relating to human behavior and interactions.
sentences: Companies use big data to understand customer behavior.
Big data analysis requires powerful computers.
The field of big data is growing rapidly.

words.definition: An application of artificial intelligence that provides systems the ability to automatically learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed.
sentences: Machine learning is used in facial recognition.
Many AI systems rely on machine learning.
Machine learning helps computers make predictions.

words.definition: A subset of machine learning in which artificial neural networks, inspired by the human brain, learn from large amounts of data.
sentences: Deep learning is used in self-driving cars.
Deep learning models can recognize images and speech.
It's an advanced form of machine learning.

words.definition: A system of hardware and/or software that is modeled after the human brain and nervous system.
sentences: Neural networks are key to artificial intelligence.
Researchers are developing new neural networks.
The neural network can learn from data.

words.definition: The interconnection via the Internet of computing devices embedded in everyday objects, enabling them to send and receive data.
sentences: Smart home devices are part of the Internet of Things.
The IoT connects many devices to the internet.
The Internet of Things is growing rapidly.

words.definition: An electronic device that is able to connect to other devices or networks and can operate to some extent interactively and autonomously.
sentences: My smart device can control the lights.
Smart devices make daily tasks easier.
Many homes now have multiple smart devices.

words.definition: The use of largely automatic equipment in a system of manufacturing or other production process.
sentences: Automation helps increase efficiency in factories.
Many tasks can be done through automation.
Automation is changing the way we work.

words.definition: The branch of technology that deals with the design, construction, operation, and application of robots.
sentences: Robotics is a fascinating field of study.
Advances in robotics are changing industries.
She is studying robotics at university.

words.definition: An AI-powered software agent that can perform tasks or services for an individual.
sentences: Siri and Alexa are virtual assistants.
My virtual assistant helps me set alarms.
Virtual assistants can answer questions and play music.

words.definition: A computer program designed to simulate conversation with human users, especially over the Internet.
sentences: Many websites use chatbots for customer service.
The chatbot answered all my questions.
Chatbots are becoming more advanced.

words.definition: A set of rules or a process to be followed in problem-solving operations, especially by a computer.
sentences: Search engines use complex algorithms.
The algorithm helps sort data efficiently.
Understanding algorithms is key to computer science.

words.definition: A formal language used to communicate instructions to a machine, particularly a computer.
sentences: Python is a popular coding language for beginners.
Learning a new coding language can be challenging.
There are many different coding languages.

words.definition: The process of writing computer programs.
sentences: Programming is a valuable skill in the tech industry.
He spends hours on programming projects.
Programming involves problem-solving.

words.definition: The process of creating, designing, deploying, and supporting software.
sentences: Software development is a complex process.
She works in software development.
Good software development practices lead to better products.

words.definition: The work involved in developing a website for the Internet or an intranet.
sentences: He is studying web development.
Web development includes front-end and back-end work.
Web development skills are in high demand.

words.definition: The act or process by which a mobile app is developed for mobile devices.
sentences: Mobile development is focused on creating apps for smartphones.
She specializes in mobile development for iOS.
Mobile development requires knowledge of different platforms.

words.definition: An interdisciplinary field that uses scientific methods, processes, algorithms and systems to extract knowledge and insights from data.
sentences: Data science helps businesses make informed decisions.
He is pursuing a career in data science.
Data science combines statistics, computer science, and domain knowledge.

words.definition: A professional who protects computer systems and networks from cyber threats.
sentences: A cybersecurity analyst identifies and responds to security breaches.
She works as a cybersecurity analyst for a large company.
Cybersecurity analysts are crucial for protecting data.

words.definition: Technical assistance provided to users of computer hardware or software.
sentences: Call IT support if you have computer problems.
IT support helps resolve technical issues.
He works in IT support for a university.

words.definition: Technical assistance provided to users of computer hardware or software.
sentences: I called tech support when my internet stopped working.
Tech support can help with software installation.
Good tech support is important for customer satisfaction.

words.definition: A service that provides information and support to computer users.
sentences: Contact the help desk for technical assistance.
The help desk is available 24/7.
She works at the university's help desk.

words.definition: The assistance and advice provided by a company to those people who buy or use its products or services.
sentences: Good customer service is important for any business.
I had a positive experience with their customer service.
Contact customer service if you have questions about your order.

words.definition: A book or document that provides instructions on how to use a product or system.
sentences: Read the user manual before using the new device.
The user manual explains all the features.
I lost the user manual for my camera.

words.definition: A set of instructions for learning how to do something or for using a piece of software.
sentences: Watch this video tutorial to learn how to edit photos.
The website offers many helpful tutorials.
I followed a tutorial to build my website.

words.definition: An online seminar or presentation.
sentences: I attended a webinar on digital marketing.
Many companies host webinars for training.
Register for the upcoming webinar.

words.definition: A digital audio file made available on the Internet for downloading to a computer or mobile device.
sentences: I listen to podcasts during my commute.
This podcast tells interesting stories.
You can subscribe to your favorite podcasts.

words.definition: An electronic version of a printed book that can be read on a computer or handheld device.
sentences: I prefer reading e-books on my tablet.
Many classic novels are available as e-books.
You can download e-books from the library.

words.definition: A recording of a book being read aloud.
sentences: I listen to audiobooks while driving.
Audiobooks are great for learning on the go.
She enjoys listening to fantasy audiobooks.

words.definition: A course of study delivered over the Internet.
sentences: I'm taking an online course in coding.
Online courses offer flexibility for learning.
Many universities offer online courses.

words.definition: An online learning environment where students and teachers interact.
sentences: We attend classes in a virtual classroom.
The virtual classroom allows for interactive learning.
Many schools use virtual classrooms now.

words.definition: The ability to find, evaluate, create, and communicate information using digital technologies.
sentences: Digital literacy is an important skill for everyone.
Schools teach digital literacy to students.
Improving digital literacy helps navigate the online world.

words.definition: An intensive training program that teaches programming skills.
sentences: He attended a coding boot camp to change careers.
Coding boot camps offer fast-paced learning.
Many coding boot camps guarantee job placement.

words.definition: A newly established technology company designed to grow rapidly.
sentences: She works for a promising tech startup.
Many tech startups are based in Silicon Valley.
The tech startup launched a new app.

words.definition: Money provided by investors to startup firms and small businesses with perceived long-term growth potential.
sentences: The tech startup secured venture capital funding.
Venture capital helps new companies grow.
They are seeking venture capital for their innovative idea.

words.definition: An affluent individual who provides capital for a business startup, usually in exchange for convertible debt or ownership equity.
sentences: An angel investor provided the initial funding.
She found an angel investor for her tech company.
Angel investors often provide mentorship as well.

words.definition: The practice of funding a project or venture by raising monetary contributions from a large number of people, typically via the Internet.
sentences: They raised money for their project through crowdfunding.
Crowdfunding platforms make it easy to support new ideas.
The film was funded by crowdfunding.

words.definition: Denoting software for which the original source code is made freely available and may be redistributed and modified.
sentences: Linux is an example of open source software.
Many developers contribute to open source projects.
Open source software promotes collaboration.

words.definition: Software that is owned by an individual or a company and cannot be freely copied, distributed, or modified.
sentences: Microsoft Windows is proprietary software.
Proprietary software often comes with technical support.
Many businesses use proprietary software for specific tasks.

words.definition: Software that is available free of charge.
sentences: You can download many useful freeware programs.
Freeware is free to use but may have limitations.
This photo editor is freeware.

words.definition: Software that is distributed free on a trial basis with the understanding that users may be required to pay for it later.
sentences: I downloaded the shareware version to try it out.
Shareware allows you to test software before buying.
Some shareware has limited features until purchased.

words.definition: Permanent software programmed into a read-only memory.
sentences: Update the firmware on your router for better performance.
Firmware controls the basic functions of hardware.
Sometimes a firmware update is needed to fix bugs.

words.definition: A computer program that operates or controls a particular type of device that is attached to a computer.
sentences: Install the printer driver to make it work.
You need the correct driver for your graphics card.
Update your drivers regularly.

words.definition: A device that is connected to a computer but is not an essential part of it.
sentences: A printer is a peripheral device.
Keyboards and mice are common peripherals.
I bought new gaming peripherals.
